etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘explain the moral meaning of’): from French moraliser or medieval Latin moralizare, from late Latin moralis (see moral)

definitions: comment on issues of right and wrong, typically with an unfounded air of superiority

examples.text: the solution to climate change is not to moralize from on high
the news media are sure to moralize about the arrogance of power

shortDefinitions: comment on issues of right and wrong

definitions: reform the character and conduct of

examples.text: he endeavored to moralize an immoral society

definitions: interpret or explain as giving lessons on good and bad character and conduct

examples.text: mythographers normally moralize Narcissus as the man who wastes himself in pursuing worldly goods

shortDefinitions: interpret or explain as giving lessons on good and bad character and conduct
